features.name: Adrenaline Rush
features.description: You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. When you do, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You can use this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all uses on a Long Rest.

features.name: Relentless Endurance
features.description: When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

features.name: Draconic Ancestry
features.description: You are a descendent of a dragon. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type.

features.name: Breath Weapon
features.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone or 30-foot line (your choice). Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes 1d10 damage of the type associated with your Draconic Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10). You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all uses on a Long Rest.

features.name: Damage Resistance
features.description: You have Resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic Ancestry.

features.name: Fiendish Legacy
features.description: You are the recipient of a fiendish legacy. Choose one: Abyssal (Poison spray cantrip), Chthonic (Chill touch cantrip), or Infernal (Fire bolt cantrip). You also learn additional spells at levels 3 and 5 based on your choice.

features.name: Otherworldly Presence

weaponMastery.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of three kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices. At certain Fighter levels, you gain additional weapon mastery (level 4: 4 weapons, level 10: 5 weapons).

changes.secondWind: You can use Second Wind a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all uses on a Long Rest.
changes.actionSurge: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a Short Rest or Long Rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest.

changes.arcaneRecovery: Once per day when you finish a Short Rest, you can regain expended spell slots. The spell slots can have a combined level equal to or less than half your Wizard level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.
changes.ritualAdept: You can cast any spell as a Ritual if that spell has the Ritual tag and the spell is in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.
changes.scholarlyPursuit: You gain proficiency in one skill from: Arcana, History, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, or Religion.

changes.sneakAttack: Beginning at 1st level, you know how to exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal extra damage to one creature you hit with an Attack Roll if you have Advantage on the roll and the attack uses a Finesse or Ranged weapon. The extra damage is 1d6, and it increases as you gain levels (shown in Sneak Attack column of Rogue table).
changes.cunningAction: Starting at 2nd level, you can take a Bonus Action on each of your turns to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

changes.channelDivinity: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity. You start with two Channel Divinity options: Divine Order and Turn Undead. You can use Channel Divinity a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all uses on a Long Rest.
changes.divineOrder: You can choose Protector (Heavy armor proficiency and Martial weapon proficiency) or Thaumaturge (Bonus cantrip and +1 to cantrip damage at level 1).

changes.rage: You can enter a rage as a Bonus Action. While raging, you gain bonus damage to melee attacks using Strength, resistance to physical damage, and advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. Your rage lasts for 10 minutes or until you are knocked unconscious. You can use Rage a number of times shown in the Rage Uses column (2 at level 1), regaining all uses on a Long Rest.
changes.weaponMastery: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of Simple or Martial Melee weapons of your choice.

heroicInspiration.description: Heroic Inspiration is a special benefit that can be granted by the DM or earned through certain features. When you have Heroic Inspiration, you can expend it to reroll any d20 Test (attack roll, saving throw, or ability check), and you must use the new roll.

weaponMastery.description: If you have the Weapon Mastery feature, you can use the special properties of weapons you've mastered. Each weapon has a mastery property that provides tactical benefits in combat.

backgrounds.description: In D&D 2024, backgrounds have been significantly expanded. Each background provides: +2 to one ability score and +1 to another (or +1 to three different scores), proficiency in two skills, proficiency with one tool, a language, and a 1st-level Origin feat.
